other_tests.findings: Identified novel heterozygous variants in ACAN, which encodes aggrecan, associated with short stature, advanced bone age, and premature growth cessation.
In Family 1, bone age was advanced at 9.0 years when chronologic age was 5 years 2 months. Remained advanced approximately 4 years above chronologic age.
other_tests.changes_over_time: In Family 3, advanced bone age of 13 years at 11 years 7 months confirmed by repeat assessments.

other_tests.date: At 7 years and 5 months of age
other_tests.findings: Normal with no signs of skeletal dysplasia.
Normal with no indications of GH deficiency, hypothyroidism, early puberty, or increased sex steroid production.

other_tests.procedure_name: Bone mineral density assessment using Dual X-ray Absorptiometry
other_tests.findings: Bone mineral densities in the normal range.
